name: Dry Hard Cider
synopsis: Refreshing sparkling alcoholic cider that is clear and of light straw color. With low residual sugars and medium alcohol content, it is better serve cold.
history: There are documented references of the Romans encountering hard cider in Britain two thousand years ago. Dry Hard Cider is a classical alcoholic beverage of great tradition.

data.label: Is the juice cloudy?
data.details: A cloudy (vs transparent) juice means the juice contains pectin protein that contributes to the gelification of the final product. This is usually undesirable and must be taken into account.

data.label: How much liquid? (in Liters)
data.details: The volume of the original juice will greatly affect many aspect of the recipe.

data.label: Measure the original gravity of the juice. (In Specific Gravity, SG)
data.details: The original gravity is an indicator of the quantity of sugar present in the apples.

data.label: What is your desired ABV?
data.details: ABV or Alcohol by volume is a measure of the alcohol content of a beverage. Higher ABV are associated with better conservation and improvement.

data.label: Original Tanning Levels (0-low, to 10-high)
data.details: Tannins levels influence the body and character of the final product.

data.label: What is the PH of the juice?
data.details: The PH influences the balance, tanginess, preservations, sulfite levels, and others.

data.label: Desired Tanning Levels (0-low, to 10-high)
data.details: This makes the link from the level of tannin your juice currently has, and the desired level. Must be above original level. (and on the same scale)
